text: Bad Kissingen is a city in Bavaria, Germany. About 22,421 people lived there in 2020. == History == It was first mentioned in 801 CE. It is a "spa town", a place where people go to rest and relax. The well that is the source of the spa was first mentioned in 823 CE. == Well-known people == * Jack Steinberger (born 1921), American physicist and Nobel Prize winner ==References== == Other websites == Category:Spa towns in Germany Category:Bad Kissingen (district)
title: Bad Kissingen
